# BIDEN BOWS OUT

## LATE REVERSAL UPENDS RACE FOR WHITE HOUSE AS PRESIDENT ENDORSES HARRIS TO LEAD TICKET

![](images/0.jpg)


President Biden began changing his mind Saturday, officials said, and he made a final decision Sunday. Below, a portion of his letter.

It has been the greatest honor of my life to serve as your President. Mr. Biden will not only fulfill my duty to the country for me to stand down partly this year, but December 31 will also be a time to come together and best Trump. Let’s do this.”

### Vice President Suddenly Enters Spotlight After Years in Shadow

BY MICHAEL D. SHERAL

WASHINGTON — Vice President Kamala Harris, who has struggled for nearly four years in President Biden’s shadow, was thrust on Sunday into the center of a remarkable political drama that could culminate with her becoming the first woman of color at the top of a major-party presidential ticket.

Mr. Biden’s decision is shadowing his new role with an odd arcade his. Harris is poised to cast his new role in a powerful moment, but certain to become the next face of the Democratic Party: charged with preventing former President Donald Trump from returning to the Oval Office for another four years.

“Today I want to offer my full support and endorsement to Kamala to be the successor of our party this year. Democrats — it’s time to come together and best Trump,” Mr. Biden wrote in a social media post after he announced his decision to step aside.

Mr. Harris’s decision is also shadowing his new role with an odd arcade his. Harris is poised to cast his new presidential moment, but certain to become the next face of the Democratic Party: charged with preventing former PresidentDonald Trump from returning to the Oval Office for another four years.

“Today I want to offer my half support and endorsement to Kamala to be the successor of our party this year. Democrats — it's time to come together and best Trump,” Mr. Biden wrote in a social media post after he an

Vice President Kamala Harris vowed to win the nomination.

nounced his decision to step aside. “I’m of this.”
